name: OBSERVATOIRE EUROPEEN DE LA NON-DISCRIMINATION ET DES DROITS FONDAMENTAUX
goal:
The European Observatory for Non-Discrimination and Fundamental Rights is a European Non-Governmental Organisation.

I. The purposes and missions of the European Observatory for Non-Discrimination and Fundamental Rights are :

- to promote in educational, cultural and social sectors, non-discrimination, fundamental rights and fundamental freedoms, at the level of national institutions and European Union institutions ;

- to promote, in educational, cultural and social sectors, human dignity as well as fundamental rights and related fundamental freedoms, and all bioethical questions;

- to highlight and promote in educational, cultural and social sectors, Institutions of the European Union ;

- to promote, in educational, cultural and social sectors, European citizenship and the rights related to it, as guaranteed in particular by the conditions of the Treaty of the European Union and the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union ;

- to promote European culture.

II. We attach particular importance to the following actions and view them as priorities :

- Access to justice ;

- Asylum, migration and borders issues ;

- Fight against extreme poverty, against social exclusion and in favor of social inclusion in the countries of the European Union, especially by providing for :

• free distribution of meals,
• emergency shelter,
• access housing,
• and support to professional and social integration ;

- Hate crime ;

- Rights of the child ;

- People with disabilities and inclusion ;

- Homeless persons rejected because of their sexual orientation / LGBTI ;

- Gender equality / Equality between men and women ;

- Racism, related intolerance, and integration of ethnic, national and religious minorities in the countries of the European Union ;

- Roma / Integration of Roma persons in the countries of the European Union;

- Privacy and data protection.
interests: Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Youth
euInitiatives:
Access to justice;
Combating extreme poverty and social exclusion while encouraging social inclusion ;
Homelessness issues and programs ;
Fight against trafficking in human beings ;
Asylum, migration and borders issues ;
Children's Rights ;
Equality between men and women ;
Persons with disabilities and inclusion ;
Racism and related intolerances / integration of ethnic and national minorities in the European Union ;
Roma Rights in the European Union ;
Hate crime in the European Union ;
Persons discriminated against on the basis of sexual orientation or gender / LGBTIQ ;
Privacy and data protection ;
Bioethics - Transhumanism.
